personal_info.job_title: Software Engineer | Senior Java Full Stack Developer

summary: Full Stack Java Developer with + 15 years of experience in both backend and frontend development. Known for a strong work ethic, adaptability, and excellent interpersonal skills. Adept at working independently or with teams in fast-paced settings. Seeking a challenging role where I can leverage my expertise to drive innovative solutions and contribute to the success of the organization.

education.degree: Master’s in Electrical and Computers Engineering
education.dissertation: Distributed wireless sensor network management system
education.summary: The dissertation integrated a group of 5 theses that aimed to develop a wireless sensor network accessed through a mobile ad-hoc network of patrol nodes and managed through a distributed system of portals. The role of my thesis was the development of the distributed system of Web portals that gave access to a user over the dispersed wireless sensor network. It addressed issues like mobility, data acquisition and persistence, messages exchange, and the integration of web technology with message-based middleware. This thesis approached the development over a J2EE platform, following the classical three-layer approach. It defined a portal hierarchy, enabling the existence of a central main portal, and several operational portals running on desktop PCs, laptops, PDAs. It proposed a model of eventual consistency to allow the geographical and functional distribution of WSN applications control. The thesis development emphasized the technology integration aspects, including patrol node intermittent communication, and the graphical presentation of the data collected from the sensors, using graphics and Google Maps API. All implementation was based on open-source technology, using XML/SOAP with Java tools for Web services, implementing a distributed messaging. My studies covered also other areas like: IT/ICT, Electronics, Digital systems, Robotics, Control and Decision

work_experience.company_description: Arhs Group is a Luxembourg-founded, independent group of companies specializing in managing complex IT projects and systems. Established in 2003, Arhs has grown organically to encompass about 16 entities worldwide.
work_experience.client_description: Ingenico Group is a company providing payment services. Its mission is to provide merchants with a comprehensive and innovative range of services and solutions that eliminate payment complexity and make purchasing quick, seamless and secure for consumers, whatever the sales channel or payment method.
work_experience.project_description: The Acquirer Hub project for Ingenico is a comprehensive, scalable payment platform designed to centralize and enhance payment services for acquirers, independent service providers (ISVs), and merchants. This platform allows acquirers to offer a broad range of payment methods and services through a single integration point, improving operational efficiency and reducing complexity. The Acquirer Hub project consists in providing a common API to contact the various acquirers (i.e. the banks of the merchants). It is used by the different services of Ingenico Group and considered as the new generation platform to connect to acquirers. The target is to have connections to around 40 acquirers using that common API. It is the target platform to connect new acquirers for all Ingenico entities. Existing connections are progressively migrated to Acquirer Hub as well. The system follows a micro-service architecture, using an internal framework. The connection to the acquirers is realized through different protocols: ISO8583 binary protocol, HTTP , etc. The messaging can be through both synchronous and asynchronous messages, with a persistence layer based on Cassandra. A queuing for the feedback platform with Apache Kafka. A file storage using Amazon S3 API (Minio implementation). An encryption using HSM (Hardware Security Module).All the services are released and deployed in an automated way. The configuration and deployment is automated using Puppet and Hiera. The workflow to promote versions from one environment to another one until production is based on GOCD. Monitoring of the services is mainly done using ELK stack in combination with Grafana and Graphite. Alerting is based on Icinga. Machine provisioning is based on Foreman. The project is implemented with high security standards, and it fits within the scope of PCI-DSS regulations. The project follows an agile approach, based on SCRUM.A release is shipped to production after each Sprint review using canary deployment strategy. Each release contains 18 different services deployed on 72 VMs.

work_experience.company_description: Arhs Group is a Luxembourg-founded, independent group of companies specializing in managing complex IT projects and systems.Established in 2003, Arhs has grown organically to encompass about 16 entities worldwide.
work_experience.client_description: Publications Office of the European Union, OP is “an inter-institutional body, and functions under the auspices of the European Commission. It is governed by a Management Committee, on which each institution is represented by its Secretary-General. In order to bring information to the citizen, the Publications Office cooperates with the EU institutions, agencies and bodies to further enhance the transparency of the legislative process and of European policies and to facilitate access to European legislation and information published in the L (Legislation), C (Information and Notices) and S (Public procurement) series of the Official Journal and on the related EUR-Lex and TED websites. The citizen has access to European Publications through the EU Bookshop and contact information for EU Officials can be found via EU “Whoiswho”, the official directory of the European Union.”
work_experience.project_description: The eTendering system for OPOCE (Publications Office of the European Union) is an electronic platform designed to manage public procurement procedures for the EU institutions and bodies. It facilitates the publication, submission, and processing of electronic tenders, replacing traditional paper-based tendering processes with a more transparent, efficient, and secure digital workflow. eTendering website is part of a bundle of services that exist to give the public greater access to information about public tenders in the European Union, as well as to improve the management of the public procurement procedures.

work_experience.project_description: The OP Portal Search System is an online search platform developed by the Publications Office of the European Union (OPOCE). It provides users with access to a vast range of EU general publications, legal documents, data, and metadata stored in the EU’s digital repository, CELLAR. The Search Layer designed for the Publications Office (OP) to be used as the single interface to access all content (data and metadata) stored and managed by the Publications Office. Basically, OPPSS provides an interface for the indexation and multilingual search of the content published by OP.

work_experience.project_description: CELLAR is the common digital repository of the Publications Office of the European Union (OPOCE) designed for the storage, management, and dissemination of official EU publications and their metadata. It serves as a centralized archive, storing multilingual publications and metadata, and provides access for both humans and machines using semantic web technologies. CELLAR is the common repository for all public websites of the Publications Office having as objective to provide the content to the different portals of the Publications Office including EUR-Lex, TED, CORDIS and EU bookshop. CELLAR can be seen as a FRBR (Functional Requirements for Bibliographic Records) system, based on RDF (Resource Description Framework) a metadata data model. Basically, a repository of documents and associated meta-data. It's part of a whole integration system that manages the distribution of legal document publications throughout official European entities and services. Destined for the OPOCE ,the Office for Official Publications of the European Communities, the publishing house of the institutions and other bodies of the European Union.

work_experience.project_description: The new.CERES (Common Electronic REception System) is a project associated with OPOCE (Office for the Publication of Official Publications of the European Communities). It is designed as an electronic reception system to digitize and automate the reception and handling of official publications and documents within the EU institutions and bodies. The system aims to streamline the process of receiving, managing, and distributing official documents electronically, replacing traditional paper-based workflows. It supports secure check-in, digital document handling, visitor or document tracking, and provides a standardized platform to improve operational efficiency and compliance with EU regulations on official publications. As part of an integrated framework for managing electronic reception, standardization, and archival of official EU documents and publications new.CERES serves as the front-end electronic reception gateway, METACONV ensures metadata standardization and conversion, SYBORG manages the data flow and synchronization, and CELLAR stores and preserves the publications and records securely.

work_experience.project_description: SYBORG (SYnchronized Buffered ORGanizer) is a standalone Java application developed as an integration chain designed to receive and process data packages created by CERES (Common European Registry for Enforcement Sources). It was a project under OPOCE (Office for the Publication of Official Publications of the European Communities), aiming to facilitate the harmonization and standardized exchange of enforcement-related data across EU member states. This application acts as a buffered organizer that synchronizes incoming data streams to ensure orderly processing and integration within the broader system of cross-border enforcement information exchange. It supports interoperability and seamless data integration necessary for EU-wide legal and administrative enforcement cooperation.

work_experience.company_description: OneTree Technologies was a Luxembourg-based company specializing in business and IT solutions, including VAT refund systems. They developed two notable projects related to VAT refund between entities.
work_experience.project_description: VATLux: This was a VAT refund system implemented for Luxembourg's tax administration to comply with the EU directive 2008/9/EC. It automated and managed VAT refund procedures as mandated by the EU, facilitating refund claims processing and administration. VRCA (VAT Refund Core Asset): A pan-European software solution enabling EU Member States to comply with the VAT refund directive by fully automating VAT refund procedures. VRCA was designed to be deployed on January 1, 2010, the deadline for countries to have compliant VAT refund systems. This solution enabled the Dutch Tax Administration to manage VAT refund claims in line with the EU directive 2008/9/EC, supporting the administration in handling refunds between entities in different EU countries and streamlining the refund process digitally. It allowed processing of VAT refund claims from both local and foreign established companies and helped manage EU certification for national VAT refund systems.
responsibilities: Enhanced front-end performance through server-side pagination integrated on numerous tables across the application, reducing load times for table-heavy views.
Contributed to the full development cycle of different features added to both projects VATLux and VRCA
